p: The most common cardiac manifestations of dengue are arrhythmias. Several case reports have also described disturbances such as sinoatrial block with atrioventricular dissociation, and atrial fibrillation, during the critical phase ( Kaushik et al., 2010, Mahmod et al., 2009). During convalescence, rhythm disturbances such as sinus pauses, first-degree heart block, and Mobitz type I atrioventricular block have all been described, as well as atrial and ventricular ectopy.
